results.title: The Silver brumby : bravery in the bush (PC & Mac)
results.brief_description: Minimum system requirements for PC: Pentium 100Mhz or better, 16MB of RAM, 256 VGA graphics, Windows compatible 16 bit sound card, 14” monitor set to 256 colours. MAC: Power PC 100 Mhz or better, 16MB of RAM, Sound Manager 3.0, 14” monitor set to 256 colours. From the classic Australian feature film, videos and TV series based on the much loved novels by Elyne Mitchell comes this new CD ROM. Untamed by man and unbroken in spirit, the Silver Brumby captures all the drama and spirit of Australian animals in their natural habitat, while teaching children about the importance of protecting our wildlife and assisting reading and comprehension skills. This CD ROM features 20 beautifully illustrated storybook pages, with several alternate conclusions, as well as 8 fun and challenging puzzles to solve. Suitable for ages 3-8.

results.title: The Silver brumby (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Media World Features, Colin South and John Tatoulis
results.brief_description: Based on Elyne Mitchell’s famous novel, “The Silver Brumby” is set in the Australian Alps, where a rogue stallion is king of the mob of horses which roam the awesome landscape. For years, the mountain men have tried to capture him, but with no success. One horseman is determined to succeed where others have failed and embarks on an unforgettable adventure. Starring Russell Crowe, Caroline Goodall and Ami Daemion.

results.title: The Silicon factor
results.brief_description: The silicon chip has become cheaper and has doubled in sophistication each year. The film looks at what it is, how it works, how it is made, and at its mushrooming applications. Some idea of what goes on inside the “black box” of the microcomputer is given by use of animated cartoon film. Finally we are asked how far computer controlled machines can go in imitating human functions.

results.title: The Silent one
results.creator_credit: David Gibson, Gibson Film Productions and Yvonne MacKay
results.brief_description: A deaf mute boy, Jonasi, the Silent One, arrives as a baby floating in from the sea to an isolated, paradisical Pacific village. He is adopted and raised by a childless woman. As a pubescent boy he is separated from the villagers and the coming-of-age rituals by his silence and their prejudices. In his isolation he seeks solace in the sea, with which he has always had a special, gifted bond. He developes a special relationship with a huge white turtle. Times are bad: the superstitious villagers blame both Jonasi and the turtle who are seen as evil spirits. A struggle for leadership sweeps Jonasi to his strange destiny. Starring Telo Malese (Jonasi), Pat Evison, Anzac Wallace, Rongo Tupatea Kahu. Spectacular underwater photography by Ron and Valerie Taylor. Based on the novel by Joy Gowley.

results.title: The Silent feminists: America's first women directors

results.title: The Silent epidemic
results.creator_credit: David Mills and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Alzheimer’s Disease is a fatal illness few people have heard of, yet as many as one in twelve old people in Britain are likely to contract it and thousands of young people also suffer from it. The fact that its symptoms - confusion, loss of memory, aggression and incontinence - are similar to those of old age has allowed it to be largely ignored by the medical profession.

results.title: The Silent battle
results.creator_credit: John Martin-Jones, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Christopher McCullough
results.brief_description: The disease of tuberculosis and the methods being adopted to fight it. Tuberculosis in the 19th century was the deadliest and most widespread disease in the western world. The “wasting sickness” spread until the bacillus was isolated and the X-ray machine invinted. Microphotography shows the white corpuscle attacking the bacilli and forming lesions. The work of the mobile X-ray units. Revolutionary changes in treatmnet with new drugs. By constant vigilance the disease can be kept in check.

results.title: The Silence of the lambs [Portuguese subtitles]
results.creator_credit: Orion Pictures Corporation, Strongheart Films, Edward Saxon, Kenneth Utt, Ron Bozman and Jonathan Demme
results.brief_description: Based on the best-selling novel by Thomas Harris, “Silence of the Lambs” is a disturbing and chilling thriller. The film which won five Academy Awards, is highlighted by the superb performances of Jodie Foster as FBI cadet Clarice Starling and Anthony Hopkins as the psychotic criminal, once brilliant psychiatrist, Dr. Hannibal “the Cannibal” Lecter. Starling’s job is to tap Lector’s mind in order to find the serial killer known as “Buffalo Bill”, a killer who skins his victims. Lector uses his macabre knowledge to entice Clarice into intricate but chilling mindgames. The film’s focal point is not so much the catching of the killer, but the relationship between Starling and Lector. The audience is manipulated so that Lecter is simultaneously repellent and charismatic, thus contributing to the tension and unease of the film. In English with Portugese subtitles.
